alert.note: Alert for Sheridan (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 6:37AM MDT until June 19 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: .Excessive rainfall Wednesday evening resulted in minor flooding along Little Goose Creek and minor street flooding in and around the cities of Sheridan and Big Horn. Water levels may be slow to recede due to additional light rainfall over and near the Big Horns this morning. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT TODAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Wyoming, including the following county, Sheridan. * WHEN...Until noon MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 AM MDT, urban and small stream flooding is occurring in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.20 inches are expected over the area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sheridan and Big Horn. - Low lying areas adjacent to Little Goose Creek will also see minor flooding. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
